intro: Persicaria pulicariodea, commonly known as the narrowleaf smartweed, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. The plant features slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often reddish at the base. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink to reddish-purple, appearing in late summer to early fall. Persicaria pulicariodea is often found in disturbed or wetland environments and is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
